results.title: A Rat's tale = Die Story von Monty Spinnerratz
results.creator_credit: Hans Peter Clahsen, Monty Filmgesellschaft, Warner Bros Pictures and Michael F. Huse
results.brief_description: Featuring marionettes from Germany’s Augsburger Puppet Theatre, this is a love story with a difference, where the action is below the city streets and the star crossed lovers are rodents. The story is a combination of the children’s book by Tor Seidler and illustrated by Fred Marcellino, and an elaboration on a short story pilot by Monty Spinnerratz. Isabella Noble-Rat is swept off her feet by Monty Mad-Rat Jnr. after an impressive tour of New York’s underground sewers. Her parents are against their daughter’s union with someone beneath their station, much to Isabella’s chagrin. There are bigger issues at hand however as the rat community is threatened by rising drain waters and a proposed mass extermination of the rodent community. Perhaps Isabella’s beau can save the day and impress her snooty parents at the same time. Cast includes Beverly D’Angelo, Jerry Stiller, Josef Ostendorf and Lauren Hutton, and featuring the voices of Lynsey Bartilson, Ray Guth, Scott MacDonald and Donald Arthur.

results.title: A Rag tapestry by 25 children
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and George Zabriskie
results.brief_description: A series of workshops for children at the Metropolitan Museum of Art reveals the entire process involved in making a rag tapestry. Follows process from initial concept through drawing to production. Using wool scraps the 8-12 year-olds create, at little cost, a colorful 3 x 10 foot tapestry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and George Zabriskie

results.title: A Race of horses
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and Kit Denton
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the breeding and training of racehorses in Australia. Includes scenes of foaling, breaking-in and handling the young horses, and an actual race sequence. Photographed by renown cameraman Dean Semler.

results.title: A Race against people: the story of Hong Kong's re-housing programme
results.creator_credit: Hong Kong Film Unit and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The story of Hong Kong’s Re-housing Program. The re-settlement of new migrants and other Chinese members of the community in to high-rise housing provided by the authorities at public expense. Commentary by Eamonn Andrews.

results.title: A Question of time
results.creator_credit: Nuffield Foundation, Judy Goodfield, Stephen Toulmin and Don Levy
results.brief_description: Treats in a new cinematic manner man’s unequal struggle to gain an intellectual grasp on the idea of time, its origin, measurement and place in theoretical physics. An exploration of the concept of time reduced to a human scale and ranging through the major historical developments; mans first notion of time; its relation to movement and more recent concepts of biological time, time in relativistic terms.

results.title: A Question of may
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Communicating”.
A corporate training film on the nature and importance of effective communication skills within the work place. A mock training session is intercut with dramatic situations depicting the problems of miscommunication.
